ai: Machine learning tools: what are they good for, what are they not, and what are some of the social consequences.
accessibility: Tech should be for everybody. Let's make that better.
CRM: Constituent/Client/Customer Relationship Management software. I did more of this in a previous job, so don't expect much new here but there are some legacy notes.
CSS: Cascading Style Sheets, used for adding styles to websites.
DevOps: Development tools, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery/Deployment (CI/CD), and generally the processes that streamline development operations.
Drupal: Working with the Drupal content management system, either with UI configuration or with code.
Linux: Managing Linux servers, including bash scripts and Docker container definition.
Microsoft 365: Aspects of Microsoft's productivity and cloud suite, including usage and administration.
PHP: PHP code, the language that I work in the most often.
Security: Security and privacy, both at the personal consumer level and in organizational contexts.
Static Sites: Building websites with static site generators, such as eleventy used for this site.
Tech and Society: Not as much how-to as most tags, instead musing about the impact of technology on the world.
Visual Studio Code: Notes on using VS Code, my primary development environment.
WordPress: The WordPress content management system. I used to do this much more often, so I probably won't be adding too much more to this one.
